com.xmlmind.ditac.convert

Class ResourceCopier

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.xmlmind.ditac.convert.ResourceCopier
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ResourceHandler

    public class ResourceCopier
extends java.lang.Object
implements ResourceHandler
    An implementation of ResourceHandler which simply copies its resource arguments to the directory specified in its parameter string.

    For example, if parseParameters(java.lang.String) has been invoked with a "graphics" argument, handleResource("file:/home/john/doc/img/logo.png", "/tmp", console) copies logo.png to /tmp/graphics and returns "graphics/logo.png".

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Description copied from interface: ResourceHandler
        Reset the internal state of this ResourceHandler. Invoked by the PreProcessor before a run. Allows the PreProcessor to reuse the same ResourceHandler to process several documents.
        Specified by:
        reset in interface ResourceHandler

      • handleResource

        public java.lang.String handleResource(java.net.URL resourceURL,
                                       java.lang.String resourceType,
                                       boolean isImage,
                                       java.io.File outDir,
                                       Console console)
                                throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: ResourceHandler
        Process specified resource.
        Specified by:
        handleResource in interface ResourceHandler
        Parameters:
        resourceURL - The URL of the resource to be processed
        resourceType - The MIME type of the resource; null if unknown
        isImage - true if the resource is for sure an image file
        outDir - The directory where the input resource, as is or modified, is to be copied
        console - Console on which progress, trace, debug, etc, message can be displayed. May be null.
        Returns:
        The properly escaped, relative to outDir, URL of the processed resource.

        Return null if default processing is to take place. The default processing does nothing at all and returns resourceURL.toExternalForm(). This means that the deliverable will point to the resources referenced in the source document.

        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if, for any reason, this operation fails
